issues.title: functional_tests/test_current_fillament.py does not actually test y-directed fillament
issues.body:
See lines:

```
    self.assertTrue(err_z < 4.7)      
    self.assertTrue(err_x < 4.7)      
    self.assertTrue(err_z < 4.7)      
```

Last one should be err_y. If changed, the test fails. There is probably something wrong with the rotation of the reference result.

issue_comments.body:
On Tue, Jul 26, 2011 at 3:27 AM, elezar
reply@reply.github.com
wrote:

> In this case, should we edit the source, and then create a new issue for the failing test?

I think we should do this all in one. I should probably do it, since I
know what the test is supposed to do! So I'll assign this to myself,
and do it later.

> ## 
> 
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub:
> https://github.com/cemagg/sucem-fem/issues/7#issuecomment-1650875

commits.message:
Merge pull request #13 from braamotto/master

Changes made to SUCEM:FEM examples to work with FEniCS 1.0.0, SciPy 0.10.1 and NumPy 1.6.1

Merge pull request #12 from elezar/master

A small edit to the README.md file.
Added a link to the wiki getting started page.
A small edit to the README.md file.

Merge pull request #11 from braamotto/master

Fixed build_doc.sh and added html to .gitignore.

Merge pull request #10 from elezar/master

Fixed PEC specification in Albani-Bernardi '74 example.
Fixed Albani Bernardi example. Updatated PEC specification.

Merge pull request #9 from elezar/master

Fixed bug in resonant cavity example.

This also fixes issue #8 as reported by @braamotto.
Fixed bug in resonant cavity example.

Merge pull request #5 from elezar/master

Added a readme file.
Fixed http:##www.gnu.org typo in file headers.
Added README file.

Merge pull request #4 from brickZA/master

Fix .gitignore to ignore .pyc files

Merge pull request #3 from elezar/master

Removed auxiliary files
Removed some extra meshes and auxiliary files.
Moved .bzrignore to .gitignore.
Added COPYING file for GPL license.
Merge from Neilen.
Merge.
Added normal orientation to interior integral calculation.
merge.
Added some comments to interior integration example.
Added standalone version of interior integral testing.
Some more work on the documentation. Epydoc now runs without warnings for the FenicsCode module.
Merge from Neielen.
Added interior integration sandbox sample.
Did some refactoring of BoundarConditions package. Specifically wrt renaming imports.
Merge from Neilen.
More work on documentation.
Added xml meshes and mesh functions to patch.

* Added doc folder and epydoc build script.
* Started improving documentation of Utilities.LinalgSolvers
Updated authors for files modified by Evan Lezar.
Fix import * for plotting.
Some boundary condition refactoring.
Added test for using GMSH facet markings in an eigenvalue problem.
Rename EMVectorWaveEigen to EMVectorWaveEigenproblem.
Added 3D testcase
removed numpy import from EMProblem

Added a functional test case based on 2D eigen problems. Note that when the two testcases were being run together, the second one was failing due to the persistence of the EMProblem.boundary condition property. This was fixed by using a proper constructor. To test, add an object (like a numpy array) property to a class and instantiate this class in two testcases. Modify the property on one test case and check the value in the second test case.
Some work on refactoring boundary conditions.
merge from Neilen.
Some refactoring of the problem classed. Both eigen and driven problems now inherit from the same base-class.
Added 2D waveguide eigenmode example.
Merge.
Implemented rudimentary default material parameters to allow for a working rectangular resonant cavity without creating material mesh functions.
Merge from Neilen.
Added UnitCube resonant cavity example. Should be moved to a unit test.
Added a generalized version of gmsh converter. Now to try to contruct mesh Object on the fly.
Refactored facet labels code.
Merge from Neilen.
Playing around with ilu preconditioner.
Merge changes from Neilen.
Added simple script for creating a mesh function from a gmsh mesh.
Some work on the specification of PEC boundaries in GMESH.
Added pyamg blackbox solver.
Copied solved test meshes to solver subdirectory.
Merge.
Added a UMFPACK solver using scipy.sparse.linalg.solve.
Added simple routine for calculating residual.
fix typo (B instead of b) in solver_driver.
Refactor solver code and make solver driver robust wrt missing matrices.
Refactored solver options into a solver class.
Add two smaller meshes for LA solver testing.
Play arround with linear solvers.
update ignore.
Added a MatrixIO module under utilities. Also implemented IO for scipy sparse matrices including a simple unit test.
Add sandbox folder and start work on a driver to test various LA solvers.
Output number of DOFs before assembly.
Merge from Neilen.
Merge.
Added a 2D waveguide example to allow for testing of the linear solvers. Changed dense matrix implementations to sparse.
Added 2D_waveguide example.
Added call to bicgstab solver to infintesimal dipole driver.

Added a Utilities module as part of FenicsCode. At present this includes a linear algebra solver based on the stabalised biconjugate gradient method as implemented in scipy.sparse.linalg. Also included is a routine to convert between a dolfin uBLASSparseMatrix and a scipy matrix. A simple sanity test for the solver has also been included as the first unit test.
Fixed remaining references to albani_bernardi74 mesh.
Removed duplicate albani_bernardi74 files.
Switched fenics_tests to FenicsCode.Consts instead of NewCode.Consts.
Added parameter for specifying number of eigenvalues and number of Arnoldi vectors to DefaultEigenSolver.
Copied albani_bernardi74 to examples folder. TODO: cleanup the fenics_test folder.
Added examples directory for later use
Added tests folder to be used for unit tests.
Copied Const.py from NewCode and updated imports in FenicsCode to reflect this change. The aim is to remove the NewCode dependecies with time.

issue_comments.body: A tag, `initial-import` was created before deleting the relevant files. The source was tagged as `0.0` after this.
In this case, should we edit the source, and then create a new issue for the failing test?

## I was hoping that you would say that :)

www.evanlezar.com

GoogleTalk: evanlezar
Skype: evanlezar

commits.message: Changes made to SUCEM:FEM examples to work with FEniCS 1.0.0, SciPy 0.10.1 and NumPy 1.6.1
Added generated html files to .gitignore.
Fixed module_name in build_doc.sh to sucemfem.
Use uintc rather than uint32 in point_source for portability
